title: [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: "Find" Feature Not Working Anymore for old messages after a channel has been restor... Looks like Lakshmi from 3s left a comment in the ADO case, 3S likely has to manually re-index, seeing as how its been more than 30d since the restoration. Issue 6174344 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: "Find" Feature Not Working Anymore for old messages after a channel has been restor... This is assigned out already by Archan 3s Oncall suggested reaching out to , Archan is out for the week, tapped a resource on his team, im not seeing an oncall rotation for their team in ICM. 3s Oncall suggested reaching out to , Archan is out for the week, tapped a resource on his team, im not seeing an oncall rotation for their team in ICM. No update to the ADO. Reaching out to the 3s Univeral Middle Tier Oncall to get some feedback on this one. No update to the ADO. Reaching out to the 3s Univeral Middle Tier Oncall to get some feedback on this one. Transferring to correct team.  Transferring to correct team. Affected Tenant: Issue /Problem Description: A team channel that was deleted by error on 6/29 and restored the same day. After that the find functionality is not working anymore, there are some searches that are showing up and other ones not.  User Affected: Troubleshooting: This is happening to all the users that have access to the channel and occurs in both versions' web and installed application.  1. Are you using the search bar at the top of Teams or the Ctrl+F shortcut within the channel? R/ This is happening when trying to use the Ctrl+F shortcut.  2. Was the channel restored using the Teams Admin Center, PowerShell, or another method? R/ The channel was restored by the Channel owner by using the restore option in the “Manage Team” menu.  3. Were there any retention policies, compliance holds, or SharePoint sync issues involved? R/ As we know there is no policy, hold or sync issue involved in this issue.  4. Are new conversations or files searchable using the Find feature since the channel was restored?  R/ Yes, the new content created after the restoration in the channel are searchable.  5. Does the search issue occur in other Teams channels as well, or is it limited to the restored channel? The issue is limited to the restored channel; the other channels doesn’t have this issue.  Team name: KP Advanced Care at Home Virtual Hub Team Channel name: NEW Patient Care Channel type: Standard.  Analysis done on ICM 666345984: https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v5/incidents/details/666345984/summary  The /query call is not returning results for the searched keyword for a message sent before the channel restored. This is a substarte search service issue. title: [S500] [OED] [CRITSIT]: Emails are not refreshing automatically in Outlook Web Access (OWA). Users need to manually click the folder to see new emails or the updated count.. Depending on how users are opening the shared mailbox, this is by design. Emails/Count Not Automatically Updating in Shared Mailboxes ( Web view ) Acknowledging incident Duplicate of Incident 660540392 : [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [CRITSIT]: Emails are not refreshing automatically in Outlook Web Access (OWA). Users need to manually click the folder to see new emails or the updated count.. Depending on how users are opening the shared mailbox, this is by design. Emails/Count Not Automatically Updating in Shared Mailboxes ( Web view ) Acknowledging incident Severity change from 3 to 2. Reason Matching DFM SEV. Transferred from Exchange Enterprise Cloud/ECC LiveSite SRE to Exchange/EC Commercial LiveSite. This incident has been transferred from the SRE queue due to a severity increase. Affected Tenants: mastercard.onmicrosoft.com/ Issue Problem Description: Emails are not refreshing automatically in Outlook Web Access (OWA). Users need to manually click the folder to see new emails or the updated count. This issue does not occur in Outlook Desktop, where emails show up properly. Since multiple users are using this workaround is not an option for us.  User Affected: Bindu Sagar Ojha and other users using the shared mailbox L1_support_C& Forest: exchange/namprd14-005-01  Business Impact: All users using the shared mailbox are impacted, causing delays in email communication and workflow disruptions.  Troubleshooting:  Verified that the issue occurs in OWA but not in Outlook Desktop. Sent test email to the shared mailbox, which shows up automatically in Outlook but requires manual refresh in OWA or click on any other folder then click back on inbox. Checked mailbox statistics and confirmed that the inbox folder is under the limit. Logs collected include PPT and HAR files. Same behavior when we add shared mailbox as Additional mailbox or add as additional mailbox/folder in same OWA session. Same issue on different computers and different browsers. Tried on different network too. One of Impacted user: Impacted shared mailbox:L1_support_C& Mailbox Statistics for primary mailbox ItemCount:330993 TotalItemSize:39.03 GB (41,912,313,139 bytes) DeletedItemCount288997 TotalDeletedItemSize:45.69 GB (49,057,584,596 bytes) IsArchiveMailbox:False  Mailbox Statistics for archive mailbox ItemCount:1075 TotalItemSize:100.8 MB (105,701,085 bytes) DeletedItemCount::29571 TotalDeletedItemSize:94.89 GB (101,890,448,930 bytes) IsArchiveMailbox:True   Has License Assigned: True  Inbox folder is also under limit  Date:3/10/2021 12:35:51 AM FolderSize:3.541 GB (3,802,595,806 bytes) ItemsInFolder:44042 VisibleItemsInFolder:35571 HiddenItemsInFolder:8471 FolderAndSubfolderSize:31.39 GB (33,704,958,493 bytes) ItemsInFolderAndSubfolders:242529  As per har do not see a pattern.   Workarounds: Users can manually refresh the inbox folder in OWA to see new emails.  Similar bugs: Not specified  Additional Information:  16+ members have access to the shared mailbox. Same behavior observed when the shared mailbox is added as an additional mailbox or folder in the same OWA session.   Reviewed https://aka.ms/OwaEsc: Yes  Enterprise Cloud Customer: Yes Submitted via Assist365 by: Agent: CaseNumber:2507160040003680 Severity:Sev2 TenantId: A customer raised issue for an Enterprise Cloud customer has been detected

description: Error: Couldn't switch the mailbox into Sync Source mode.  This could be because of one of the following reasons:    Another administrator is currently moving the mailbox.    The mailbox is locked.    The Microsoft Exchange Mailbox Replication service (MRS) doesn't have the correct permissions.    Network errors are preventing MRS from cleanly closing its session with the Mailbox server. If this is the case, MRS may continue to encounter this error for up to 2 hours - this duration is controlled by the TCP KeepAlive settings on the Mailbox server.  Wait for the mailbox to be released before attempting to move this mailbox again. -->  -->

context.businessImpact: Error: Couldn't switch the mailbox into Sync Source mode.  This could be because of one of the following reasons:    Another administrator is currently moving the mailbox.    The mailbox is locked.    The Microsoft Exchange Mailbox Replication service (MRS) doesn't have the correct permissions.    Network errors are preventing MRS from cleanly closing its session with the Mailbox server. If this is the case, MRS may continue to encounter this error for up to 2 hours - this duration is controlled by the TCP KeepAlive settings on the Mailbox server.  Wait for the mailbox to be released before attempting to move this mailbox again. -->  -->

title: [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Meetings are kept as tentative in the room even though they are being accepted by de... for further updates. @ NITIN BHUTANI I have escalated this to the dev team for assistance on this. Please follow Issue 6089190 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Meetings are kept as tentative in the room even though they are being accepted by de... for further updates. Logs attached in VSO due to size issue. Issue 6089190 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Meetings are kept as tentative in the room even though they are being accepted by de... Logs attached in VSO due to size issue. Issue 6089190 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Meetings are kept as tentative in the room even though they are being accepted by de... ok ok Following up with feature team on this through teams. Following up with feature team on this through teams. When  Delegate click on accept we see 200 Ok call in har but when we refresh we see same screen again to click on accept. https://outlook.office.com/owa/service.svc?action=RespondToMeetingMessage&app=Mail&n=66 Request Method POST Status Code 200 OK Remote Address Affected Tenants: Issue /Problem Description: Meetings are kept as tentative in the room even though they are being accepted by delegate.  User Affected:  Room Mailbox ID: Delegate: Forest: exchange/namprd19-002-01  Business Impact: Important meeting is getting missed as Organized doesn't get approval message. Delegates thinks they have approved. Unless they refresh OWA/Outlook. Status remained same.  Troubleshooting:   Room Mailbox delegates approved meeting is not getting processed. Once they approved we see call like https://outlook.office.com/owa/service.svc?action=RespondToMeetingMessage&app=Mail&n=66 However, if we refresh OWA it again shows accept,Decline options. Same issue happening from OWA and Outlook Both. We have tried removing and readding delegates. They informed it happening with multiple room mailboxes. They tried adding different users as delegate issue remained same. Tried to toggle Automateprocessing and still no change. Compared settings from lab and did not find any issue.  Room Mailbox ID: Delegate: As per har logs: We see response 200ok. Same as per lab repro in customer case. However, we see no update in customer case . Also, Organizer do not see acceptance that meeting is accepted by delegate. Customer tried to check in room mailbox and it doesn't show its approved.  We do not see this event for Delegate in customer case if response is sent:IPM.Schedule.Meeting.Resp.Pos. We see IPM.Schedule.Meeting.Resp.Pos in Delegate CDL in lab repro. However, in lab we do see this event following 200k same like below.  Request URL https://outlook.office.com/owa/service.svc?action=RespondToMeetingMessage&app=Mail&n=66 Request Method POST Status Code 200 OK Remote Address 40.99.34.210:443  =================================================  {     "Header": {         "ServerVersionInfo": {             "MajorVersion": 15,             "MinorVersion": 20,             "MajorBuildNumber": 9073,             "MinorBuildNumber": 17,             "Version": "V2018_01_08"         }     },     "Body": {         "__type": "RespondToMeetingMessageResponse:#Exchange",         "ResponseCode": "NoError",         "ResponseClass": "Success"     } }  As per RBA logs in customer case and in lab we only see we see delegate received invite. However post processing we do not see any update in RBA logs. Please help us finding reason why its happening. Issue is reproducible on demand.  Workarounds:   Similar bugs: https://o365exchange.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Services/_workitems/edit/5910770 https://o365exchange.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Services/_workitems/edit/4948362  Additional Information: CDL logs/Repro logs(From customer and Lab)  Enterprise Cloud Customer: Yes Submitted via Assist365 by: Agent: CaseNumber:2506130030003445 Severity:Sev2 TenantId: A customer raised issue for an Enterprise Cloud customer has been detected

title: [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Not getting notification in OWA - 6009563 Acknowledging incident linking related ticket for OWA Incident-665861452 Details - IcM bug was created by OWA team Bug 383910 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: Not getting notification in OWA - 6009563 Acknowledging incident Affected Tenants: Issue /Problem Description: Not getting notification in OWA  User Affected: All the users are not getting notifications(toast notification in OWA)  Confirmed the following steps:  1. Notification Setup: ·                Check Notification Settings: Ensure that the notification settings in Outlook on the web are correctly configured. You can navigate to the app settings and confirm that notifications are enabled and functioning as expected.  - Go to OWA's settings -> General -> Notifications. - Ensure Outlook notifications, mail notifications, and calendar notifications are enabled. - Choose the notification style 'Browser' or 'Alert'.   2. Windows Settings: - Check Windows System settings for Notifications, Focus, and Power settings to ensure they are correctly configured.   3. Types of Notifications: - Change Notifications: These use a persistent connection to keep the client in sync with the server, leveraging SignalR. - Push Notifications: These are sent directly to the OS using services like WNS, APNS, FCM, or WebPush in the browser.  References: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/outlook-notifications-aren-t-working- https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/mail-and-calendar-notifications-in-outlook-com- Confirmed that all registry settings are correct. title: [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: The RSVP flyout in meeting messages received by Delegate does not show Accept Declin... The team behind this functionality has already released a hotfix for this issue. Can we please confirm with the users involved that they are still seeing this issue? If so, please re-raise this issue. Auto Resolving incident The fix for this issue has already been released. Can we confirm with the customer that they are still seeing this issue? Issue 6043333 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [ISSUE]: The RSVP flyout in meeting messages received by Delegate does not show Accept Declin... The team behind this functionality has already released a hotfix for this issue. Can we please confirm with the users involved that they are still seeing this issue? If so, please re-raise this issue. Auto Resolving incident Affected Tenants: / elililly.onmicrosoft.com  Issue /Problem Description: The RSVP flyout in meeting messages received by Delegate does not show Accept Decline button and Subject. GLSAccountForest  NAMP162A001.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM GLSResourceForest NAMP162.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM  Business Impact: RSVP flyout does not have accept decline button. Delegate need to open the meeting request or use reading pane to Accept / Decline meeting  Troubleshooting:  The issue is experienced in both OWA and New Outlook clients.  The issue happens only for meeting received by Delegates for Manager.  Users own meeting does show the Accept Decline on RSVP flyout  The issue repro in our lab tenant consistently. The support case owner has collected the har for both OWA and New Outlook.  the .har and repro video is added.  Repro Steps:  Send meeting invite to Manager. Delegate would receive it in Inbox. Click on RSVP button. Repro Result:  The flyout will not have Accept Decline button or even Subject. Expected result:  Should have Subject and Accept Decline button in RSVP flyout  Workarounds: To Use the reading pane to Accept Decline meeting or Double click and open meeting  to Accept Decline meeting  Similar bugs:  Additional Information:  Reviewed https://aka.ms/CalEsc: Yes  Enterprise Cloud Customer: Yes Submitted via Assist365 by: Agent: CaseNumber:2508040040004669 Severity:Sev3 TenantId: A customer raised issue for an Enterprise Cloud customer has been detected

title: [S500] [ISSUE]: Cannot Create Agenda (Loop) in New Teams Calendar Same issue as : Issue 5924402 [Customer Escalation] [ISSUE]: Unable to Add Agenda (Loop) Due To Error: "Recipients can't access links" Which was noted as related to : Issue 5885048 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [ISSUE]: Cannot Create Agenda (Loop) in New Teams Calendar Bug : Bug 375031 Collab agenda fails to create due to CSP restrictions on Outlook @ Paolo Phan at mentioned you in a related escalation, that was claimed to be related. Multiple tenants were mentioned as affected. Issue 5885048 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [ISSUE]: Cannot Create Agenda (Loop) in New Teams Calendar Same issue as : Issue 5924402 [Customer Escalation] [ISSUE]: Unable to Add Agenda (Loop) Due To Error: "Recipients can't access links" Which was noted as related to : Issue 5885048 [Customer Escalation] [S500] [ISSUE]: Cannot Create Agenda (Loop) in New Teams Calendar Bug : Bug 375031 Collab agenda fails to create due to CSP restrictions on Outlook Synced with Eshaan on this one, he confirmed its already started working again for the customer Once thing is clear is the loop attachments were triggering a getDlpPolicyTip call which could have been calling for a policy block - there's a call in the har called label?filter=applicableTo that shows the policy details, if this happens again would suggest focusing on the policy details for the policy tip that may have been triggered. As for the root cause, everyone's been trying to get an update from the Component owners, a direct connection to the "Recipient Can't Access Links" isn't drawn, their updates are infrequent, short and unclear, he pointed out that it "maybe" related to a CSP (Content Security Policy), which makes sense but requires further validation with the customer. Affected Tenants: | deloitte.onmicrosoft.com  Issue /Problem Description:   ++ In New Calendar app for Teams, when an agenda (loop) is added and the user attempts to send the meeting, they receive the following error "Recipients Can't Access the link" ++ The issue does not happen in Classic Teams calendar.  ++ Looking at the screenshot of the error below, it appears a sensitivity label is getting applied and may be related to why the error is being thrown (speculation on my part) ++ We have another customer escalation which appears to be the same issue. Getting the same error when agenda is added and you attempt to send the invite. In the other escalation, we see a sensitivity label was applied to the agenda/loop as soon as it was added.   User Affected: Forest: Exchange/NAMPRD85-001-01  Business Impact: High   Troubleshooting:  ++ HAR attached. Short repro video also attached. title: [S500] [ISSUE]: Inconsistent result from App Deployment. Customer wants to deploy app with the option for ... Affected Tenants: Forest: exchange/canprd01-001-01 ExchangeOnlineProtection/ca01-01 The source Vsts item ' 5867955 ' has had a description change or a discussion update. Please visite the source item to gather more information. The source VSTS item ' 5867955 ' has been resolved @ . Sync from this item has been suspended and will not resume unless the VSTS item is reopened. Please check the source item for more details. The source Vsts item ' 5867955 ' has had a description change or a discussion update. Please visite the source item to gather more information. The source Vsts item ' 5867955 ' has had a description change or a discussion update. Please visite the source item to gather more information. Response Managers Disengaged until upcoming reconvene at  6/20/2025 T 10:30 Reconvene next actions : Workaround: Leveraging Classic Outlook will make it so they can delete the add-in. In OWA, navigate to https://outlook.office365.com/mail/inclientstore and remove from there. Current Status: Centralized Deployment team, Joshua Turpen and Christian Guzman Loza have identified what is causing the issue and need to work with the Taos\Platform Services team to find a solution.   Reconvene: 10:30AM PST tomorrow 6/20 to see where we are at with the investigation. Centralized Deployment team will update the chat if there is anything found between now and then. OCE required for reconvene : CXRE, ACE, support, Centralized Deployment (Joshua Turpen, Christian Guzman Loza) RA to ECERM in case of a re-raise End user impact : If an admin deploys add-ins for the users, if they select "Optional" or "Available" when creating that add-in, the end user actually doesn't have the ability to delete those add-ins even though they should. Root Cause : CA team knows the problem and are working with the proper team to fix. Outstanding actions : SHD Post : Timeline : Task OwnedBy TaskStatus Time(PST) Comment Raise the support case to sev A Dario Galante (CSS) In Progress 6/19/2025 2:23 AM Support case is at sev B, Dario Galante (CSS) is going to be working internally on raising the case to sev A to get proper engineering traction. Dario (CSS) confirmed that no updates have been shared by PG since early May, and the customer is growing impatient. Look into previously provided data Joshua Turpen (Centralized Deployment OCE) In Progress 6/19/2025 2:24 AM Joshua Turpen (Centralized Deployment OCE) says he needs more time to look into the previously provided data. He also needs to sync with Christian Guzman Loza, who's in the Redmond time zone. We'll be syncing at 9:30am PDT, seeking an update from the Centralized Deployment team. Timeline can be found in aka.ms/SCRIBE submitted by : Scott Beier CxRE Disengaged RA to CxRE in case of a re-raise End user impact : If an admin deploys add-ins for the users, if they select "Optional" or "Available" when creating that add-in, the end user actually doesn't have the ability to delete those add-ins even though they should. Root Cause : A previous change (over a year ago) made to fix a bug was for MOS API to call RemoveApp on EXO services.  But this fails for Org apps with Available or Optional flag. How Mitigated : A previous change (over a year ago) made to fix a bug was for MOS API to call RemoveApp on EXO services.  But this fails for Org apps with Available or Optional flag. The fix is to call RemoveApp and if it fails call DisableApp (previous behavior).    Fix PR: https://office.visualstudio.com/MetaOS/_git/TPS-AppServices/pullrequest/4179796 Outstanding actions : SHD Post : WorkStreams : Task OwnedBy TaskStatus Time(PST) Comment Raise the support case to sev A Dario Galante (CSS) Completed 6/19/2025 2:23 AM Support case is at sev B, Dario Galante (CSS) is going to be working internally on raising the case to sev A to get proper engineering traction. Dario (CSS) confirmed that no updates have been shared by PG since early May, and the customer is growing impatient. But this fails for Org apps with Available or Optional flag. The fix is to call RemoveApp and if it fails call DisableApp (previous behavior).   Fix PR: https://office.visualstudio.com/MetaOS/_git/TPS-AppServices/pullrequest/4179796 Timeline : Timeline CxRE Time(PST) Sev 2 escalation has been raised up by support for a sev B SAP case, however the case is already 94 days old. There have been several other escalations raised to PG at sev 3 level, looks like the issue has not been addressed. David Domonkos 6/19/2025 2:18 AM Support case is at sev B, Dario Galante (CSS) is going to be working internally on raising the case to sev A to get proper engineering traction. Joshua Turpen (Centralized Deployment OCE) is looking into the data that has been already provided by the customer, however as he has no previous insight into this escalation, he needs some time to troubleshoot.  We're also waiting for Christian Guzman (Centralized Deployment) to come online (during Redmond hours), as he's worked and owned this escalation at sev 3 level and see, whether he has any updates. Dario (CSS) confirmed that no updates have been shared by PG since early May, and the customer is growing impatient. David Domonkos 6/19/2025 3:42 AM Synced with Jase on the side to get his opinion on this case. We've sent and RA to Centralized Deplyoment as we haven't heard back from  Joshua Turpen (Centralized Deployment OCE) on his investigation of the customer provided data. Joshua said he needs more time to look at the data, but so far he hasn't been able to find anything suspicious in the .har file. He also needs to sync with his teammate, Christian Guzman Loza who's been owning a previous escalation of this issue at sev 3. We've agreed that the best course of action is to set a reconvene for 9:30am PDT, to allow the OCEs some time to sync on this issue before they can provide us with an update.  In the meanwhile,  Dario Galante (CSS) is still working on getting SAP's support case to sev A. This has been raised to us as a PSI at sev 2 saying 10s of tenants are impacted, however after asking Dario whether he can get us a list of impacted tenants and support cases, he only knew about one more support case from a non-OED tenant, which we don't have confirmation from PG on this being the same issue as SAP is facing.  At this point in time, we're not yet sure about this being a service-side issue, that's why no communications have been sent out. We need PG (Centralized Deployment) to confirm whether this is a service side issue or not before sending out communications. SAP ACE Tosin Ojekale has been brought up to speed on the issue as well. This is the same DCR in outlook queue - Incident 645017366 : [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [DCR]: New Outlook - Save Reply Same Folder Also, a work item created under outlookweb queue for tracking - Bug 370188 : [Customer Escalation] [S500] [OED] [DCR]: Feature Parity with Classic Outlook - New Outlook - Save Reply Same Folder - 5868482 Considering this is DCR, I would resolve this IcM and let CSS track above bug for triage and progress... Acknowledging incident Issue / Problem Description: Affected Tenants: sap.onmicrosoft.com   DCR Description:   How are users in your environment using the product/technology directly related to this issue?  Users in our environment are leveraging the “Save reply in same folder” to efficiently organize and manage their mailbox. This feature enables them to easily manage their emails and keep them in the same place, based in the emails subject.  Is this blocking a deployment?  How so?  Users that rely on this feature to manage their emails are not willing to migrate to New Outlook because the lack of this feature impact their daily management.  What functionality are you attempting to provide and why are you using your current approach?  Users want to be able to keep their email messages organized when they reply to an email that is not in the inbox and keep messages in the same folder for that subject.  How is the problem keeping you from performing specific business functions?  (if the problem is not resolved)  The users need to take various additional steps to work around the feature that was available in Classic Outlook.  What is this issue's financial impact to you? n/a     How was this financial impact calculated? n/a  What is the problem's frequency and probability? Since this is a missing feature, the problem frequency is constant.  Number of end users and/or desktops impacted (Number): Approx. 10.000 users impacted.  What current workarounds are in place, and why are they not acceptable/optimal? In these cases, since this is a missing feature, users need to keep using Classic Outlook.  If there are additional circumstances or notes you wish to provide regarding this problem that are not covered by the answers to the above questions – what are those? n/a  Similar bugs:  https://outlookweb.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Web/_workitems/edit/255097     Reviewed https://aka.ms/OwaEsc: Yes  Enterprise Cloud Customer: Yes Submitted via Assist365 by: Agent: CaseNumber:2506061420002379 Severity:Sev3 TenantId: A customer raised issue for an Enterprise Cloud customer has been detected
